summary: This module is a benchmark program that compares the performance between standard strlcpy/strlcat functions and sendmail's sm_strlcpy/sm_strlcat implementations. It runs millions of iterations of these functions and measures execution time to determine which implementation is faster.

logs.reason: Called when the gettimeofday system call fails, which prevents the benchmark from being able to measure execution time
logs.resolution: This error indicates a system-level issue with timekeeping. Check for system resource problems or operating system issues that might interfere with the gettimeofday function.

logs.message_template: The configuration indicates the system needs the libsm versions of strlcpy(3) and strlcat(3). Thus, performing these tests will not be of much use.
logs.reason: Informs the user that testing isn't meaningful because the system is configured to use libsm versions of these functions rather than native implementations
logs.resolution: As mentioned in the message, set SM_CONF_STRL to 1 in site.config.m4 file if the OS has native strlcpy/strlcat implementations.

logs.reason: Reports benchmark results for the standard strlcat function
Reports benchmark results for sendmail's sm_strlcat function
Indicates that the performance difference between the two functions is too small to make a clear determination

logs.message_template: ** results too close redoing test %ld times **
logs.reason: Informs the user that the benchmark is being re-run with more iterations to get a clearer performance difference
Reports benchmark results for the standard strlcpy function
Reports benchmark results for sendmail's sm_strlcpy function
